artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: a group of mourners lowers Jesus's body onto a wide dais or coffin outside a cave
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate at bottom: [Heere Christ into his Sepulcher is laid, / But not by those by whome hee was betraid, / The Friers and Monkes I meane, for they are fled. / Now they have seene him Crucified and dead.]

numbered in plate at lower right: [14]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Entombment of Christ, From the Satirical Passion
